banking.rest.resources

Class AccountResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • banking.rest.resources.AccountResource

  • @Path(value="accounts")
public class AccountResource
extends java.lang.Object
    AccountResource is a JAX-RS resource representing an account. It supports the following use cases: 
     
  1. Get all accounts
  2. Get a single account
  3. Delete an account
  4. Update an account
  5. Create an account
    Author:
    nevenc

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAccounts()

      • getAccount

        @GET
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAccount(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                      java.lang.Integer id)
        Gets a single account. GET http://XXXX/accounts/{id}
        Returns:
        Response object with a found account (id={id}). Response object with 404 status (NOT FOUND) if account not found.

      • saveAccount

        @POST
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response saveAccount(Account account)
        Creates a new account. POST http://XXXX/accounts
        Parameters:
        account - Account object will get created and injected from request body
        Returns:
        Response with status 201 (CREATED) and location of the created resource. e.g. Location: http://XXXX/accounts/{newid}

      • updateAccount

        @PUT
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateAccount(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                         java.lang.Integer id,
                                                                         Account account)
        Updates an account. PUT http://XXXX/accounts/{id}
        Parameters:
        id - Account id will get parsed from URI path
        account - Account object will get created and injected from request body
        Returns:
        Response with status 200 (OK) and updated account object.

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteAccount(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                            java.lang.Integer id)
        Removes an account. DELETE http://XXXX/accounts/{id}
        Returns:
        Response object with status 200 (OK) and deleted account object.
